org.unallied.mmocraft.regions

Class Region

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unallied.mmocraft.regions.Region
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DesertRegion, HillsRegion, ShatteredRegion

    public abstract class Region
extends java.lang.Object
    Regions are "groups" of chunks that behave in a particular manner. Regions have their own biome, name, lighting, monsters, and so on. A Region is responsible for telling the World how the blocks inside of the region should be generated. This means that a Region can determine its geometric structure as well as the blocks that are contained within that region.
    Author:
    Faythless

    • Method Detail

      • setRegions

        public void setRegions(Region topRegion,
              Region rightRegion,
              Region bottomRegion,
              Region leftRegion)
        Sets the surrounding regions. If no region is at this location, use null.
        Parameters:
        topRegion - region directly above this region
        rightRegion - region directly to the right of this region
        bottomRegion - region directly below this region
        leftRegion - region to the left of this region

      • getValue

        public double getValue(libnoiseforjava.module.Perlin perlin,
              int x,
              int y)
        Returns a perlin value (-1 to 1) for a specified coordinate. It is possible to obtain values outside of this range. Before the perlin value is retrieved, an average is performed between the top, right, bottom, and left regions to this region. A future update might want to also include the top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left and top-left regions in this calculation. This, of course, is only a problem if our height contains multiple regions. Otherwise the problem is reduced to left/right.
        Parameters:
        perlin - The perlin object that's associated with this world
        x - The world-based x coordinate, where 0 is the far left side of the world.
        y - The world-based y coordinate, where 0 is the top of the world
        Returns:
        value between -1 and 1 (usually).

      • getBlock

        public abstract byte getBlock(double value)
        Returns a block type's value based on the value provided.
        Parameters:
        value - The "weight" value for this block. Lower values imply "dense" regions, and high values imply "airy" regions
        Returns:
        blockType value
